events.name: Bootcamp: Learn How to Build a Bookstore WebApp With Ruby on Rails - 21st Aug
events.description: We are teaching a free programming lesson for new beginners on how to build a bookstore web application with Ruby on Rails. At the end of 2 hours, you will learn how to set up a book store web application, deploy it to a live website and show off to your peers! For this lesson, you must bring along your own computer (any system) and be prepared to learn how to write code and build websites! There are no other prerequisites. Don't have a computer? Pm me and I will bring one more for you. Spaces are limited for only 30 students.  This is the same session as the RoR events which we have ran in the past. If you have attended this session before, do give priority to our newcomers!
events.location: Tri5 Ventures, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent #03-26, S139951, Singapore

events.name: Esri Workshop (For Developers)
events.description:
Programme - Customising WebApp Builder to access OneMap API - Customising widget - Q&A 


* Please bring your own laptop for hands-on session in using WebApp Builder * Light refreshment will be provided
events.location: National Design Centre, Level 2 Training Rooms, Singapore

events.name: Social Coding
events.description: A space for women coders to learn from each other, to practice and discuss learnings with fellow peers. This would be a weekly event of informal space to do coding. So bring your pet projects along or join one of our existing teams/ projects to work on. Featured Projects:https://trello.com/b/kl2BTwil/wwc-sg-social-coding-projects First timers, please read:Newbies Step-by-step Guide Please bring your own laptop. Agenda:6:30p - Registration and Introduce projects7:00p - Break out into groups and Start coding! ^_^8:30p - End session There is no food provided, so please make preparations to grab a bite before you turn up. Also, we recommend to bring your own water bottle along. Psst, this event is intended for ladies only. Host:
events.location: #03-04, IDA Labs@NDC 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre, Singapore 188969., IDA Labs@NDC 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre

events.name: HackerNest Singapore Tech Social
events.description:
*********************FISHACKATHON********************* Fishackathon returns November 18-19, 2017 in over 40 cities around the world. Be a part of the movement - an international hackathon series to make our fisheries more sustainable and equitable.  ----- HackerNest Tech Socials are a fun, relaxed way to connect with your local tech community. Atmosphere: chill, friendly, unpretentious, agenda-free (no sales pitch), and brimming with Ultra Smart People.  Follow us on Twitter and Instagram, like us on Facebook, hi-5 us in person! The typical Tech Social agenda:   - folks arrive, grab drinks, socialize   - quick announcements, thank sponsors   - back to chatting   - head home, exhilarated from great conversations!   *** HackerNest Tech Socials are Entry by Donation - any amount appreciated, $5SGD recommended. No amount is too little! If a cash donation is too restrictive, please join us anyway – just let us know at the door. *** SPONSOR: </a><a href="http://hackernest.com/sponsor_info/">Sponsors make this growing movement possible, so we treasure and build deep, long-term relationships with the companies that endorse us. Please email [masked] for ways to connect with the HackerNest community! VENUE: SpaceMob https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/lMggn2yR9slSwfWK4Q94fkHxxwo8q7QP0WCemqumA31eUC6SBXhUj0VIcqGXqkXptEnlymLCz2LMDSyyqKPLzj_t09EfP6yJh2vdalpp0kWCqU-gSqTLLx2EzX4xGNRDg6zsNH7j Tucked amidst lush greenery and perfect for those who want to sit down and get to work. It's conveniently located next to Kent Ridge MRT station, in close proximity to key research and tertiary institutions, R&D, high-tech innovation and start-up communities. You'll love it, and so do we. We're on the lookout for easy to access offices with space that can fit our audience (standing-room only). Please email [masked] (or organizer email) if you’d like to host a Tech Social! COMMUNITY PARTNER: https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/rVmaLfgG-xe9EneBmR2bRkz53H2oglyvddiwtyiScZGIU1l_8pN4niQEabgbmy4HZThgvwYU9jzRNElbUG2Hew7k-n5bWb7VraKlRh5pMUKbT6dDVt7hkRknvHNQfv7Ku0rzzwyg InternSG connect passionate learners to budding entrepreneurs and businesses for work experiences. They endeavor to support communities organisation like HackerNest to pool like-minded individuals with multidisciplinary skills in solving real world problems. COMMUNITY EVENTS:  #codeathon is a learning-intensive hackathon with the theme of "Technopreneurship for Gender Equality". Our goal is to empower complete beginners to prototype tech solutions using tools such as MIT App Inventor and the standard web stack (HTML/CSS+Bootstrap and JavaScript). Register http://bit.ly/codeathonmentor by July 18! All Day DevOps  


On October 24th, HackerNest will be supporting the Live Online All Day DevOps Conference. This is a 24 hour event with 5 simultaneous tracks, 96 sessions and 4 keynotes in 38 time zones! There are featured guest speakers galore and frankly, far too much information to list, so check out this link instead! Oh, and did we mention that the entire thing is free?  QuantCon Singapore  We’re happy to be partnering with Quantopian for QuantCon Singapore, Quantopian’s quantitative finance and algorithmic trading conference. The second annual conference in Singapore is on September 28th-30th 2017.  To register or find out more, click here. Use discount code HackerNestSG for 10% off! If you’re a Community or Meetup group looking to promote an event or discount for HackerNest members, please email [masked]. About us: </a><a href="http://hackernest.com/">HackerNest is an international nonprofit uniting local tech communities through unpretentious Tech Socials, hackathons, Tech Expos and Job Fairs. Our relaxed, down-to-earth events attract a diverse and highly technical membership. Strict 'no-scuzzbag' policy. Want to volunteer at our HackerNest Tech Socials? Visit http://hackernest.com/volunteer/ for more information and to apply!
